answers.answer: I am 36+5 and I have it as well. In the beginning, I'm not going to lie, it's scary. You will have a class to attend and will have to test your blood four times a day. After the first couple of weeks you will get used to the diet, which in all honesty isn't that bad. Just remember to be aware of your starches, sweets, fried foods, and portion control. If you have any more questions you can message me. Good luck and best wishes!
This whole thing is freaking me out, because im already picky about what foods to eat, so now im not able to have juice or certain fruits in the morning....
@Vior, I was like that as well when they told me that in the class. Happily, we can have it after our breakfast testing. :)
OMG. I was just diagnosed with it today as well. I'm freaking out .
Thank you yes im freaking out I didn't have it with my daughter's and this is really unexpected

gestational is really not that bad. its more scarry to think about then to take care of. first eat well balanced diet, it helps to measure your food. you may feel hungry the first few days of your new diet. watch you shugars and carbs. breads and pasta will rase your blood sugars, so watch them. remember to test your blood sugar and record whatyou have eaten. this will help you to find what meals work best for you. the insulin is really easy to take, just got to remember to take with each meal.  and the good news is after baby comes... most people get to go back to their normal food habits.ive now been dx 3 times.

question: Im 29 w and just got diagnosed with gestational diabetes I dont know anything about it and I hear there's a diet to follow but I just recently had all my teeth pulled does anyone have any positive feedback or advice or hopefully gone through it also
title: so im 29 weeks and just got diagnosed
